text: hi guys today I'm making something
really fun it just spicy and gelada with
an uncho raisin sauce but if you don't
like the idea of entre raisin sauce you
have two other great sauces for
enchiladas connect it to the recipe on
our website so to make your sauce what
you want to do is soak your ancho chiles
15 minutes seed them remove the stems
and then get them into a blender with a
cup of chopped onions 2 cloves of garlic
and 1 cup of water then you want to pass
it through a sieve to get rid of any
little bits that might not be such a
great texture what a beautiful brick
color and then you can season this with
a little salt and pepper so what you
want to do now is sort of fry this up a
little bit a little bit of a neutral
flavored oil like a safflower or a
canola oil you want to heat the oil
until the chim ring and then add your
chili mixture be careful because it
might splatter a little bit because hot
oil and water you know how that goes a
quarter cup of minced raisins these are
golden raisins one cup of chicken broth
and you just want to cook this simmering
for about five to 10 minutes just until
it thickens a little bit after it simmer
it can stir in a teaspoon of white
vinegar this is gonna heighten the
flavor and then just a pinch of sugar
shall we assemble I think we shall so
what I have here are eight corn
tortillas that I'm just gonna very
lightly sort of dredge in the sauce
sprinkle some cheese I have a
combination of Monterey Jack and like a
fresh cheese like a cotija or something
like that roll them up and then place
them seam side down into the baking dish
the sauce makes about two and a half
cups and I'm actually using all of it
our original recipe said to use about
one and a half cups but I like it to be
just a little saucy or so that's what
I'm doing
save a little bit of the cheese to
sprinkle on at the end
this is just a very simple cheese
enchilada but you can adapt it however
you want
leftover cooked meat of any kind as

clean your hands drizzle with another

foil
if the enchiladas in the oven and bake

those ancho chiles give a nice smokiness
